documentation.text:
@notice A controller manages a single worker address.
 controllers[controller] = worker

documentation.text:
@notice disables a controller by setting its worker to address(0).
 @param _controller The controller to disable.

params._controller: The controller to be configured with a worker.
params._worker: The worker to be set for the newly configured controller. _worker must not be a non-zero address. To disable a worker, use removeController instead.

owner().details: Tells the address of the owner

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

configureController(address,address).notice: Configure a controller with the given worker.

removeController(address).notice: disables a controller by setting its worker to address(0).

userdoc.notice: Generic implementation of the owner-controller-worker model. One owner manages many controllers. Each controller manages one worker. Workers may be reused across different controllers.
